content: marker would have been this gap between needles substitutes for a marker in the directions below decrease row 1 note that the previous row ended with a row 2 so this row will be a row 3 and will start a color change *2 cc 2 mc* etc in addition to the decrease knit the first two mc sts together using cc resulting in one cc st on the right needle then continue in *2 mc 2 cc checkerboard pattern until two sts before next marker ssk two mc sts together with a cc yarn resulting in one cc st on right needle slip marker next knit first two cc sts together using mc resulting in one mc st on right needle then continue in *2 cc 2 mc* pattern until two sts before next marker ssk two cc sts together with a mc yarn resulting in one mc on right needle slip marker repeat the sequence above twice more until you reach the bor you should have decreased 12 sts and now have 96 sts on your needles around each marker there should be 1 cc st and 1 mc st or 1 mc and 1 cc decrease row 2 knit the pattern with mc sts over mc and cc sts over cc the checkerboard pattern has been broken around the six markers with just one of each color on either side this will be corrected in the next row decrease row 3 note there is a color change on this row knit the first two cc/mc sts together with cc yarn resulting in one cc st next knit one cc st you now have two cc sts on the right needle then continue in *2 mc 2cc checkerboard pattern until three sts before next marker knit one cc st and then ssk next two cc/mc sts with cc yarn now you have two cc st that pair together on the right needle slip marker knit two cc/mc sts together with mc yarn resulting in 1 mc st knit next st with mc you now have 2 mc st on the right needle then proceed with *2 cc 2 mc* until 3 st before next marker knit one mc st ssk two mc/cc sts together mc yarn resulting in two mc st on right needle slip marker repeat this sequence twice more until you reach the bor you should have decreased another 12 sts and now have 84 sts on your needles the checkerboard pattern has now been reset and alternates with 2 cc sts and 2 mc sts decrease row 4 knit in checkerboard pattern with cc sts over cc and mc sts over mc all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free 2024kristina k miller intended for individual home use only not to be reproduced or reknit for profit row 5-8 are basically the same 4-row pattern as above with the exception that row 1 will now start with two cc sts decrease row 5 note
